TopicTitle: 99 or so ideas one should (or shouldn't) try in KSP

Articles.Content:
I've played KSP for a while, but I'm tired of sending ships, colonies or the like to other planets. That's why I want to add new fun, game-breaking possibilities to KSP, such as advanced kraken summoning or the like.

That's why I made this topic; you're free to add your own ideas if you want.

Of course you're not allowed to submit copyrighted content.

 ANYWAY, HERE'S MY IDEAS TO HAVE FUN IN KSP (AND DO SCIENCE!) 

1} File edition

  • Have fun with Kopernicus! Make Vall orbiting Laythe, and Laythe orbiting Vall, or put Eeloo in orbit of an inexistant body, like Eatar or Rituadel. 
  • Modify the save files (it's better to use a special save and not persistent.sfs) so:
  1. You can put heavy parts in a kebal's inventory, or tweak a docking port or a KAL-1000, thus making it gets more powerful.
  2. You can add "ScenarioUpgradeable" (I can't remind the name) to a Sandbox or Science save, giving you a 2nd level KSC.
  3. And more!
  • Corrupt craft files with Tweakscale and part positions, so launching your ship will lead to that great bug:
    Spoiler

    Or you can just tweak a docking port or a KAL-1000 so it gets more powerful.

  • Modify some part's config file, or texture, to make the game more interesting; so I'll try to find potatoroid.cfg and kerbal.cfg, and add the parts to the VAB / SPH part list  so I can build with Kerbals and Asteroids!       {EDIT}: For the kerbal the name is kerbalEVA.cfg, I tried to tweak it but it didn't work, I'll have to try something else. For the asteroids/comets it works but in the VAB you have just cubes and when you launch it with nothing else you'll get a dancing camera. Teleporting it anywhere with Alt+F12 will lead to an immobile, floating rock suspended mid-air annd "about to crash" if not in a stable orbit.

Added the experiment's results

2.  Tired of wasting precious fuel on long interplanetary transfers? Looking for a way to quickly travel to other star systems? Then I have a solution for you. Just

  • Use the debug menu to teleport your ship under the surface of a planet or moon
  • Fall into the center of that planet or moon
  • Success! Instant arrival to anywhere.

(Flimsy ships are not advised)
